parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To change, transform, alter, exchange. From meta and allasso; to exchange.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From alethes; truth.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A lie, falsehood, untruth; false religion. From pseudomai; a falsehood.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To worship, stand in awe of. Middle voice from a derivative of sebomai; to venerate, i.e. Adore.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.
From ktizo; original formation.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
(used only of God), blessed (as entitled to receive blessing from man), worthy of praise. From eulogeo; adorable.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
